intro: Jasione brevisepala, commonly known as the short-lobed jasione, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, typically found in rocky or limestone soils. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually blue or violet in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It has basal leaves that are hairy and lance-shaped, and its stems are usually unbranched. Jasione brevisepala is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
